mh@NSG:/var/www/memory_system$ grep -n "@app.route.*mem" /var/www/memory_system/memory_app.py 573:@app.route('/mem/search', methods=['GET']) 671:@app.route('/mem/get', methods=['GET']) mh@NSG:/var/www/memory_system$EditPerfect! The routes exist correctly in memory_app.py. Now let's test the backend directly to confirm they work: bash# Test the backend routes directly curl -I "http://:40001/mem/search?limit=1&key=public-read-2025" curl -I "http://:40001/mem/get?id=1369de11-d01f-4cb5-9b37-87d26ef0677b&key=public-read-2025" If those work, then the nginx proxy configuration needs to be corrected. The correct nginx config should be: bashsudo nano /etc/nginx/sites-available/api.nsgia.com Make sure the /mem/ location block is: nginx location /mem/ { proxy_pass http://:40001/mem/; proxy_set_header Host $host; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $remote_addr; proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto https; proxy_buffering off; proxy_redirect off; # Keep HTML content type from backend add_header Access-Control-Allow-Origin "*" always; add_header Access-Control-Allow-Methods "GET, OPTIONS" always; add_header Access-Control-Allow-Headers "Content-Type" always; } Then reload nginx: bashsudo nginx -t sudo systemctl reload nginx # Test again curl -I "https://api.nsgia.com/mem/get?id=1369de11-d01f-4cb5-9b37-87d26ef0677b&key=public-read-2025" The key is that: Routes in Flask: /mem/search and /mem/get Nginx proxy: /mem/ → http://:40001/mem/ Final URL: https://api.nsgia.com/mem/search → http://:40001/mem/search What do the direct backend tests show?Retrymh@NSG:/var/www/memory_system$ cat /etc/nginx/sites-available/api.nsgia.com # CHANGE LOG # File: /etc/nginx/sites-available/api.nsgia.com # Document Type: Nginx Configuration # Purpose: Serve memory API endpoints for ChatGPT acce
